answers.answer: I'm not familiar with this test, but I suggest eating oatmeal, fruit, and eggs, and maybe some yogurt too. I usually have that for breakfast because I have to wait a bit before I can take lunch at work, and sometimes I'm still not even hungry enough when lunch rolls around. And water! Again, that is if all of that is compliant with the glucose test.

I know the feeling..i get shaky if i dont eat after so many hours...I would eat a hardy dinner tonight and maybe snack before you go to bed...then drink lots of water in the morning. Make sure to bring food with you so you'll have something to eat after the test is done to bring your energy back up..good luck.
How many weeks are you? I'm 27 weeks and haven't taken my glucose test yet.

They recently changed the glucose test from 1hr to 2hr because many women were failing not that they had diabetes but because it took them a little longer in the first hr to break down the sugar. Take something to entertain u cause it feels like forever. Goodluck

That's what the nurse told me too. Better to do 2 hours than fail the 1 hour and have to do the 3 hour. I'll be 30 weeks on Thursday. I just changed doctors though otherwise I would have already done this.

Eat a dinner that will make you feel full and avoid everything with a bunch of sugar, even juice, sodas, pastries... prepare a snack or meal to eat as soon as your test is over. And take something to distract yourself while you're waiting for the test to be over. Take water now and then while you wait.
